intro: Actephila excelsa var. javanica, commonly known as the Java actephila, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly Indonesia, and thrives in tropical rainforest environments. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. It typically grows as an erect shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to several meters. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
